Description: Body sherd with handle root of large Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of confronted lion and sphinx (of lion, only trace of foreleg remaining; of sphinx, only forelegs); part of elaborate rosette between creatures; below, two dilute lines; below, part of handle root.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0964) (phase 2)
